snippet: The maker of Hellman’s products added the word “dressing” to comments from consumers on Hellman’s website that referred to Hellman’s mayonnaise dressing with olive oil as simply “mayonnaise.”
abstract: Unilever, maker of Hellman’s products, adds the word 'dressing' to comments from consumers on its Hellman’s website that referred to Hellman’s mayonnaise dressing with olive oil as simply 'mayonnaise;' change comes as another round in fight between company and start-up Hampton Creek, which has sued over its eggless spread Just Mayo.
lead_paragraph: The maker of Hellman’s products added the word “dressing” to comments from consumers on Hellman’s website that referred to Hellman’s mayonnaise dressing with olive oil as simply “mayonnaise.”

headline.main: Unilever, Suing Over Rival’s Use of ‘Mayo,’ Changes Own Website
headline.print_headline: Unilever, Suing Rival for Use of ‘Mayo,’ Changes Own Website
